page.title: 11BRIDGLAND QUARRY
page.content: The south bank of the Ettrick river has a gravel extraction quarrry run by a local builder the unsightly nature of the workings forced the owner to line the workings with trees Despite people preferring them not to work the river the planning aproval necessary to allow such a scheme had been granted some considerable time ago. Just to the west of the quarrry is the local refuse tip which at this time is very nearly full. The Region are in some difficulties at present as they are finding it difficult to find suitable holes in the ground to dump their refuse in.
